title: Open-source ISO Toolkit
description: ISOやISPO（Initial Stake Pool Offering）は、資金調達の手段の一つですが、まだ効率的に行うためのツールがありません。

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like a reasonable proposal, though as suggested it is all for the developer side. This requires significant trust from the user side that what is promised will be delivered. This seems like the perfect place to use a smart contract to guarantee delegators they will get their 1-2ADA back and tokens delivered based on their delegations. We are in the Alonzo era, lets take advantage of it.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers has already worked on this for their own ISO, so their is no reason to think they won't be able to deliver a packaged up version for others.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a clear set of deliverables and milestones allowing easy auditing. It would be nice to see some KPI's and goals on usage to measure success which is more than just delivering a product.

f6_assessments.q0: Very solid proposal. Creating an open-source tool that sets the template for conducting successful ISOs would incentivize ISO over airdrop. This way the invested fund remains in stake pools and the project is less vulnerable to volatility and liquidity issues, making the entire ecosystem more stable.
f6_assessments.q1: Minswap has conducted their FISO with success so far with 25 participating stake pools. So that means that the development of this tool is already halfway finished as they've identified the needs for such a tool. From their website data, the team has recently expanded to 9 individuals with linked profiles confirming their relevant experience in this field.
f6_assessments.q2: There is sufficient information available to determine the intent of the proposal. A decent plan, funding breakdown and roadmap are present. What is not present, however, is how this tool would be distributed after launch. How would the community know about its existence? How would it be marketed to become the tool to go for conducting an ISO?

f6_assessments.q0: Initial Stake Pool Offering is a method for raising capital in the Cardano community. It gives an option for developers to put forth an idea to the community and get Funds to implement the same. The proposal will build a tool kit which which will enable carrying out the process without getting into developing a custom solution. As claimed this will reduce the barrier of running an  ISO. This is addressing an important challenge of complexities associated with raising funds in Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer had carried out an ISO reportedly successfully and is has a team-building DEX in Cardano. They would have made the tool for in-house tool for conducting the ISO. Therefore it is likely that the project will be implemented in a successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The projecy aims to build the ISO toolkit in 3 months and incorporate community requests in a six months period. The cost estimated is 17.5K USD. This is likely to be the pay for two developers for two months. this is a reasonable amount for an important component that will be used by other companies planning. == ISO. The proposal has a good road map and a sharp final state, therefore it is auditable and the progress can be accurately monitored,

f6_assessments.q0: This is one impeccable proposal for the challenge. The problem stated is an inconsistency in the project that needs to be solved. The solution written in the proposal is perfect and eloquent for this problem. The proposal hits all the marks for this challenge, the toolkit will help ease the workload of the developers so they can focus on other tasks. I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team working on this proposal is prominent and active in the Cardano Community. If I could say one thing, is that it would've been helpful to provide additional links to the team's social profile. Their plan is well written and explains how they are implementing the proposal. They clearly state what to expect of the toolkit and clarify what it does. Because the team is already known within Project Catalyst from Fund5 I strongly agree that it is highly likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided by the team gives a clear vision of how the team plans to implement the proposal. Description and solution are short but give a good perception of the problem. However, the proposal is missing information about KPI's, it is not clear how they would define the success in the roadmap. How would they engage the community in the first 3 months with open-beta to help improve the toolkit? Because of the background, I still agree that the proposal gives enough information to assess the progress.

solution: プロジェクトが独自にISOを行うためのツールを開発し、オープンソース化することで、プロジェクトが時間を節約してアプリケーションの開発に集中できるようにします。
experience: MInswapのFair ISOは、Cardanoコミュニティで最も実行されているISOの一つとされています。私たちはDB SyncとCardano toolingsの経験があります。
